medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe abdominal pain, primarily in the epigastrium and right upper quadrant after consuming a steak dinner.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 hours after eating a steak dinner, starting with left shoulder pain that migrated down the left flank and then to the abdomen. Pain is currently worst at the epigastrium and right upper quadrant. The patient reports nausea and vomiting but has not experienced diarrhea. No previous biliary attacks noted.
